results.title: Here’s How Each Best-Picture Nominee Could Win an Oscar
results.abstract: “Belfast” and “The Power of the Dog” will probably face off for the top prize, but each contender has a path to other statuettes. We explain.

multimedia.caption: Caitriona Balfe, far left, and Jamie Dornan in “Belfast”; Kodi Smit-McPhee and Benedict Cumberbatch, far right, in “The Power of the Dog.”
Caitriona Balfe, far left, and Jamie Dornan in “Belfast”; Kodi Smit-McPhee and Benedict Cumberbatch, far right, in “The Power of the Dog.”
Caitriona Balfe, far left, and Jamie Dornan in “Belfast”; Kodi Smit-McPhee and Benedict Cumberbatch, far right, in “The Power of the Dog.”

results.title: ‘KIMI’ Review: Sure She’s Paranoid, but Something Really Is Out There
results.abstract: Zoë Kravitz stars in the latest from Steven Soderbergh, a story that plays with genre, triggers your anxieties and shreds your nerves.

multimedia.caption: Zoë Kravitz in Steven Soderbergh’s woman-in-peril movie “KIMI.”
Zoë Kravitz in Steven Soderbergh’s woman-in-peril movie “KIMI.”
Zoë Kravitz in Steven Soderbergh’s woman-in-peril movie “KIMI.”

results.title: ‘The Power of the Dog,’ ‘Dune,’ ‘Belfast’ and ‘West Side Story’ lead the nominations.
results.abstract: Netflix has two films in the running for a best picture Oscar: “The Power of the Dog,” with 12 nominations, and “Don’t Look Up,” with four.
results.byline: By Brooks Barnes and Nicole Sperling

multimedia.caption: Ariana DeBose in “West Side Story,” and Benedict Cumberbatch in “The Power of the Dog.” Both movies were nominated for best picture and DeBose was nominated for best supporting actress.
multimedia.copyright: Niko Tavernise/20th Century Studios; Kirsty Griffin/Netflix

results.title: 2022 Oscars Nominees List
results.abstract: The complete list of Academy Award nominees for 2022.

multimedia.caption: Nominees for the the 94th Academy Awards were announced on Tuesday morning led by “The Power of the Dog,” which received 12 nominations, and “Dune,” which collected 10.
Nominees for the the 94th Academy Awards were announced on Tuesday morning led by “The Power of the Dog,” which received 12 nominations, and “Dune,” which collected 10.

results.title: Where to Stream ‘The Power of the Dog,’ ‘Belfast’ and More 2022 Oscar Nominees
results.abstract: Most of the top contenders can be watched at home. Here’s a guide to help you get a jump on the field.

multimedia.caption: From left, Judi Dench, Jude Hill and Ciaran Hinds in “Belfast,” one of the Oscar-nominated films available to stream.

results.title: Benedict Cumberbatch Has Heard Your Confusion About ‘The Power of the Dog’
results.abstract: The actor, who just earned his second Oscar nomination, says a little ambiguity is “a good thing.”

Robbie Lawrence for The New York Times

results.title: Ariana DeBose on Her First Oscar Nomination: ‘This Role Embodies Every Facet of Me’
results.abstract: The 31-year-old actress was nominated for her turn as Anita in “West Side Story” — a part she fought to ensure reflected her Afro-Latina identity.

multimedia.caption: Ariana DeBose became a first-time Oscar nominee on Tuesday morning.

results.title: Andrew Garfield on ‘Tick, Tick … Boom,’ Jonathan Larson and the Spidey Connection
results.abstract: The actor received his second Oscar nomination and says the “lion’s share” of attention should go to the composer he plays in the movie.

results.title: Lin-Manuel Miranda on Writing Lyrics in Spanish and the Heartbreak of ‘Dos Oruguitas’
results.abstract: The singer-songwriter and director is up for an Oscar for best song for his work on “Encanto.” If he wins, he would join the select EGOT club.

multimedia.caption: Lin-Manuel Miranda at the Los Angeles premiere of “Encanto” in November.
Lin-Manuel Miranda at the Los Angeles premiere of “Encanto” in November.

results.title: ‘The Sky Is Everywhere’ Review: Amid Grief, Blossoms of Joy
results.abstract: Josephine Decker unlooses a slipstream of adolescent passion and anguish in this radiant drama about a musician grieving the loss of her big sister.

multimedia.caption: Jacques Colimon, left, with Grace Kaufman in “The Sky Is Everywhere.”
Jacques Colimon, left, with Grace Kaufman in “The Sky Is Everywhere.”
Jacques Colimon, left, with Grace Kaufman in “The Sky Is Everywhere.”

results.title: Hear Lata Mangeshkar in These Four Streaming Films
results.abstract: Because Mangeshkar lent her voice to several generations of Bollywood stars, these movies double as a highlight reel for Hindi cinema.
des_facet: Lagaan: Once Upon a Time in India (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Aamir Khan and Gracy Singh in “Lagaan” (2001), which features singing by Lata Mangeshkar.

results.title: ‘I Want You Back’ Review: Scheming Hearts
results.abstract: Jenny Slate and Charlie Day play strangers who team up to win back their exes in this pleasantly run-of-the-mill rom-com.

multimedia.caption: In “I Want You Back,” Gina Rodriguez plays Anne, an English teacher who dumps Peter (Charlie Day), a manager at a nursing home company.
In “I Want You Back,” Gina Rodriguez plays Anne, an English teacher who dumps Peter (Charlie Day), a manager at a nursing home company.
In “I Want You Back,” Gina Rodriguez plays Anne, an English teacher who dumps Peter (Charlie Day), a manager at a nursing home company.

results.title: ‘Indemnity’ Review: Fires Everywhere
results.abstract: This South African thriller trades plausibility and originality for a worthy substitute: a great deal of fun.

multimedia.caption: Jarrid Geduld in “Indemnity,” a film by Travis Taute.
Jarrid Geduld in “Indemnity,” a film by Travis Taute.
Jarrid Geduld in “Indemnity,” a film by Travis Taute.

results.title: ‘Worst to First: The True Story of Z100 New York’ Review: An FM Radio Sensation
results.abstract: A look back at a time when “excellence in broadcasting” was taken seriously, including interviews with Joan Jett, Jon Bon Jovi and other stars.
des_facet: Worst to First: The True Story of Z100 New York (Movie)

results.abstract: The real-life boxer Kali Reis plays a pugilist in search of revenge.

results.title: ‘The Pact’ Review: A Faustian Bargain
results.abstract: When a baroness summons a young poet to her estate and suggests they make a deal, he should have hightailed it back down the road.

multimedia.caption: In “The Pact,” Thorkild Bjornvig (Simon Bennebjerg) is an aspiring poet and the author Karen Blixen (Birthe Neumann) is his mischievous mentor.
In “The Pact,” Thorkild Bjornvig (Simon Bennebjerg) is an aspiring poet and the author Karen Blixen (Birthe Neumann) is his mischievous mentor.

results.title: ‘Blacklight’ Review: He’s Off the Books (But You’ve Read This One Before)
results.abstract: Liam Neeson plays a top-secret operative in an action movie that teeters between subverting the genre and obeying convention.

multimedia.caption: Liam Neeson in “Blacklight.”
Liam Neeson in “Blacklight.”
Liam Neeson in “Blacklight.”

results.title: ‘The Unmaking of a College’ Review: School’s Out Forever?
results.abstract: This documentary tells the story of a liberal-arts college that faced an existential crisis, and of how students fought back against the way potentially drastic decisions were made.

multimedia.caption: Hampshire College students organizing in the documentary “The Unmaking of a College.”
Hampshire College students organizing in the documentary “The Unmaking of a College.”
Hampshire College students organizing in the documentary “The Unmaking of a College.”

results.title: ‘Death on the Nile’ Review: Dead in the Water
results.abstract: Kenneth Branagh’s second adaptation of Agatha Christie’s Hercule Poirot stories forgets the simple pleasures of ensemble excess and pure messing about.

multimedia.caption: From left, Gal Gadot, Emma Mackey and Armie Hammer in “Death on the Nile.”
From left, Gal Gadot, Emma Mackey and Armie Hammer in “Death on the Nile.”
From left, Gal Gadot, Emma Mackey and Armie Hammer in “Death on the Nile.”

results.title: ‘The Fabulous Filipino Brothers’ Review: For Better or for Worse
results.abstract: The Abasta family of California is celebrating a wedding. The Basco family writes, directs and stars in this warm, welcoming comedy.

multimedia.caption: From left, Darius Basco, Aida Basco, Dante Basco, Dionysio Basco, Cheryl Tsai, Derek Basco and Iluminada Monroy in “The Fabulous Filipino Brothers,” directed by Dante Basco.

results.title: Irwin Young, Patron of Independent Filmmakers, Is Dead at 94
results.abstract: As the head of a prominent film processing laboratory, he helped directors like Spike Lee, Michael Moore and Frederick Wiseman early in their careers.

multimedia.caption: Irwin Young in 1996 at DuArt Film Laboratories in Manhattan. He was the company’s chief executive for more than 50 years.
Irwin Young in 1996 at DuArt Film Laboratories in Manhattan. He was the company’s chief executive for more than 50 years.
Irwin Young in 1996 at DuArt Film Laboratories in Manhattan. He was the company’s chief executive for more than 50 years.

results.title: Study Finds Sustained Progress for Female Directors and Filmmakers of Color
results.abstract: But women of color are still not getting feature directing jobs in Hollywood, the annual report on top-grossing movies finds.

results.title: Will Smith on ‘King Richard’ and His Secret Career Fear
results.abstract: The star of this sports drama isn’t planning any special celebration of his Oscar nomination: “We celebrate by creating the next thing.”

multimedia.caption: Will Smith, with Saniyya Sidney on the court, in “King Richard.”
Will Smith, with Saniyya Sidney on the court, in “King Richard.”

results.title: A Hallowed London Jazz Club Comes to Life Onscreen
results.abstract: The new documentary “Ronnie’s” tells the story of a venue that reshaped the city’s jazz scene, and the mysterious musician who lent it his name.

multimedia.caption: Ronnie Scott, one of two saxophonists who opened Ronnie Scott’s Jazz Club in London, is the focus of a new documentary.
Ronnie Scott, one of two saxophonists who opened Ronnie Scott’s Jazz Club in London, is the focus of a new documentary.

results.title: ‘Clue’ Review: A Whodunit That Looks a Lot Like a Board Game
results.abstract: This Paper Mill Playhouse production is a welcome throwback to an era of physical comedy.

multimedia.caption: From left: Sarah Hollis, Alex Mandell, Kathy Fitzgerald, Donna English, Michael Kostroff and John Treacy Egan in “Clue.”

results.title: ‘Alice’s Wonderland Bakery’: Recipes for Real Life, if Not Real Kitchens
results.abstract: A new Disney show teaches children useful lessons in the guise of a cooking show. The recipes are less practical (unless you stock dancing dodo eggs).

multimedia.caption: In “Alice’s Wonderland Bakery,” the great-granddaughter of Alice from “Alice in Wonderland” teaches young viewers valuable lessons with the help of a magical talking cookbook.
In “Alice’s Wonderland Bakery,” the great-granddaughter of Alice from “Alice in Wonderland” teaches young viewers valuable lessons with the help of a magical talking cookbook.
In “Alice’s Wonderland Bakery,” the great-granddaughter of Alice from “Alice in Wonderland” teaches young viewers valuable lessons with the help of a magical talking cookbook.

results.title: John Williams, Hollywood’s Maestro, Looks Beyond the Movies
results.abstract: The composer of “Star Wars” and “Jaws,” who turned 90 this week, says he will soon step away from film. But he has no intention of slowing down.

multimedia.caption: John Williams, a reigning film composer for half a century, says he will soon step away from movie projects.

results.title: 2022 Oscars Nominations: Snubs and Surprises for Lady Gaga and Jared Leto
results.abstract: Kristen Stewart was a surprise best actress nominee after being shut out of other precursor awards. And the academy likes not one but two acting couples.

multimedia.caption: Lady Gaga and Jared Leto in “House of Gucci.” Neither wound up getting a nomination.
Lady Gaga and Jared Leto in “House of Gucci.” Neither wound up getting a nomination.

results.title: Troy Kotsur Makes History as the First Deaf Actor to Get a Nomination
results.abstract: The performer has been a particular favorite this awards season. He stars in “CODA” as the father of a hearing daughter who dreams of being a singer.

multimedia.caption: Troy Kotsur and Marlee Matlin play deaf parents in “CODA.”

results.abstract: The singer, already the female artist with the most Grammys, will try to score her first Oscar for a song she wrote with Dixson for “King Richard.”
